topics: Bias-Variance Tradeoff; Ensemble Learning; Random Forest

grading.policies: Late submissions incur a 25% penalty if submitted within 7 days after the deadline; no submissions accepted beyond 7 days.

assignments.name: Team Project Mid-Stage Report
assignments.description: Mid-stage report for the final project.

assignments.name: Final Report and Presentation
assignments.description: Final report and presentation for the project.

policies.attendance: Students are expected to view recorded lectures and participate in live sessions.
policies.late_work: 25% penalty for late homework and project submissions within 7 days; no late submissions accepted beyond 7 days.
policies.academic_integrity: All students must adhere to the Graduate Student Code of Academic Integrity.
policies.accommodations: Students with documented disabilities can receive accommodations through the Office of Disability Services.

important_dates: May 6 - Final Report and Presentation Due

additional_info.course_format: This course is fully online with recorded lectures and live sessions.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Python 3, NumPy, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib, Jupyter Notebooks.
additional_info.support_resources: Contact Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) for course access support.

_metadata.course_description: An introductory course for machine learning theory, algorithms, and applications.
learning_outcomes: Demonstrate basic principles and algorithms of representative machine learning systems including supervised learning, unsupervised learning, batch learning, online learning, model-based learning, and instance-based learning.
Determine appropriate machine learning algorithms for real-world tasks.
Evaluate the performance of a machine learning system with appropriate performance measurement metrics.
Apply appropriate training, evaluation, and parameter tuning techniques to improve machine learning algorithms.
Develop a machine learning system with programming languages such as Python.
Create interactive documentation with program codes and rich texts.
Write a comprehensive report to communicate the main ideas, techniques, and findings of a machine learning project.
